} cv_35288281preplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_35288281preplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81C9HGdwvvS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } var node = cv_35288281preplay.parentNode; var cv_35288281currentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_35288281currentClick) { return cv_35288281currentClick(); } } } Length:: 1:06 MinsProduct works great! Its has a little bit of play in arms, but can be expected for price. I use this for a dash mount for my JVC HD-GZ10. VERY strong suction cup, I use it for exterior shots often. (See video)

Reviews.Title: Good Stuff
Reviews.Author: Randall S.
Reviews.Content: Very solid mount, I am confident using this on the outside of my car, and do not worry about the camera falling off at all.

Reviews.Title: A good strong hold.
Reviews.Author: Paul Lascari
Reviews.Content: This suction cup holds very well.  I use it in a small airplane to hold my video camera.  It has never dropped off the window where I mounted it.  Well done technology.

Reviews.Title: Glass tripod
Reviews.Author: Flyingant
Reviews.Content: This thing works vary well, I recommend it highly, grips like it is glued on, a very good product way to go

Reviews.Title: AAA
Reviews.Author: Will
Reviews.Content: This suction cup mount I have had over a year with no issues.. Its alittle bulky, but it holds forever, even in the hot sun.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: zhumingyao
Reviews.Content: i love this product its great quality and very worth the money .I hope to buy more of them thx

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Manny
Reviews.Content: The mount stayed where I put it.  The knobs tighten enough to hold my Sony Cam in its place thoughout the whole time it was mounted on my motocycle.

Reviews.Title: Great product, very sturdy.
Reviews.Author: Amr
Reviews.Content: It's Quite sturdy. When the suction is set up in the very correct way, it latches to the glass very well. The suction mechanism works excellent on glass, tried it on my flat smooth faux wood desk and latched on very strong. Yes, I do believe it will latch on any surface as long as it's solid. I tried it on my drywall in my room, but didn't work there :P I dunno, don't ask I just tried :D The screw for the camera is metal, and so are the next two pieces attached below. At that curved elbow it's plastic, but looks and feels like it's the durable plastic.Mine very much looks authentic, it has the company's logo.

Reviews.Title: Best there is
Reviews.Author: Alec Jones
Reviews.Content: I love this product so much I bought two. I Storm Chase Professionally and my car goes though everything. These things wont ever let go. Ive used my DSLR and a few camcorders on my front window and have never had an issue. Panavise suction cup is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: Excellent suction for all weather conditions
Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: I've had this on my vehicle windshield since the day I received it. I use it for my JVC road cam. After driving 17 days & over 3,496 miles up & down the East coast through hot, cold, rainy, snowy conditions, it is still stuck to the windshield. Great Buy. Also, made sure it said Panavise on the mount. I understand that there are knock-offs out there.

Reviews.Title: Too Secure - Find a Way to Damp Vibration
Reviews.Author: Brad
Reviews.Content: I've used this mount on everything from small aircraft to surface vehicles. It grips well, and offers a variety of positions for the device. Unfortunately, I lost the felt that came with it. As a result, vibrations are quickly transmitted back to the the device, resulting in unpleasant vibrations in videos.

Reviews.Title: Solid little mount.
Reviews.Author: Jack L. Cramer
Reviews.Content: I've been using this mount for at least 2 years now. Works great, camera just screws right on, mounts to my window with relative ease. Couldn't as for more out of this little guy. Does the job.

Reviews.Title: Good for in car video
Reviews.Author: Erik Anderson
Reviews.Content: good item for in car shooting of video holds well and keeps working well, if you shoot in the car this works well.

Reviews.Title: Great suction cup
Reviews.Author: John E. Bunch II
Reviews.Content: Bought this to hold my dash cam and it works great! no issues. Performs as can be expected. A must have.

Reviews.Title: Very sturdy! Doesn't lose suction!
Reviews.Author: Folsom DIY Fan
Reviews.Content: I bought this mount to record Racquetball playing sessions and it worked very well.  For on the road as a vehicle cam, this mount is not designed to absorb vibration like high-end professional units.  It works ok when traveling around 15-20 mph, any higher, the vibration will make the video very difficult to watch.  I have had this unit for nearly 4 years and it still looks good.

Reviews.Title: This thing is great
Reviews.Author: OriginalGC
Reviews.Content: I've used this many times and I love it. I am able to get some really cool shots for music videos I produce. The hold is strong and I've never had an issue with this falling off or anything of that nature.

Reviews.Title: nice well made
Reviews.Author: Uwe Behrendt
Reviews.Content: heavy duty works well I tested it on a bookshelf with my pentax SLR and it held up very well ,no shaking, solid

Reviews.Title: Innovate LM-2 window mount setup
Reviews.Author: Richard Crawford "Mr Mechanic"
Reviews.Content: Used this for my Innovate LM-2 Wideband. Works great! Very solid and the same item that Innovate sells at half the price.

Reviews.Title: Love it without the extension
Reviews.Author: David D Southwell
Reviews.Content: I love these mounts for my digital cameras.  I use them to place out and about on my car when we go off-roading. I also got the extension because it was highly-recommended, but when I put my camera on it seems to make the mount much more prone to jiggles and vibration.  I guess that makes some sense since that's generally how levers work, but I had hoped it would be more stable even with a longer arm.  I guess for longer arm needs I should go with a RAM mount.

Reviews.Title: THIS PRODUCT REALLY SUCKS!!
Reviews.Author: Ronald W. Howard
Reviews.Content: HOLDS MY CAMERA AND DIGITAL CAMCORDER TO MY VEHICLE WITH NO PROBLEMS OR WORRIES. I MADE AN ADAPTER TO HOLD MY MONITOR FOR MY BACKUP CAMERA NOW AND IS ROCK STEADY WITH NO PROBLEMS AT ALL!

Reviews.Title: Panavise Quality
Reviews.Author: Yup
Reviews.Content: Back in 1995 I worked for a company making dash cams for police cars, at the time we were using PANAVISE parts and attaching to a rear view mirror mount, this is worlds better no need to glue an extra mirror mount to your windshield. I use it with a Sony Handycam with a wide angle lens adapter and a NPFV-70 battery and it is rock solid. I have also used it on my range vent hood to video cooking (well I don't 100% trust it there so I pack a 2 pound jogging ankle weight in the cabinet with a mini-bungee cord and a carabiner just in case). I would recommend a loop of parachute cord off the sun visor clipped to the camera or mount in automotive use, just in case but I did drive around all day back roads, highway, sun, shade and there was no sign it was going to loose it's leach-like grip.Very nice range of motion on all axis. You can buy a cheap mount or you can buy the right mount for your camera (kind of like motorcycle helmet theory, if you have a $50 noggin buy a $50 helmet, this is the $500 Snell helmet of camera mounts)

Reviews.Title: Camera mount
Reviews.Author: Don Lott
Reviews.Content: Look elsewhere, the suction cup doesn't work very well. while it offers lots of possible angles the surface you want to mount it too had better be PERFECTLY flat.

Reviews.Title: The Big Mama Jama.
Reviews.Author: Crowe
Reviews.Content: This is the big mama jama of suction cup mounts.  I've only used it twice so far, but both times it is incredibly strong and doesn't let up.  I can use it to pick up the steel hood of my car! ( like 28 lbs I believe).  Adjustments are easy to make and stay where you've left them.  Excellent suction mount, especially for the low price!  (I mean... except for those complete trash suction mounts that are like 10 bucks... but please dont even try those.. they're REALLY bad)

Reviews.Title: Rock-solid camera mount
Reviews.Author: Dave Taylor
Reviews.Content: The powerful suction cup holds this device and camera onto the windshield on even the roughest, jarring roads. I had this attached to the windshield of a tractor-trailer all the way from Virginia to California. It stayed in place the entire round trip, even when I hit some of the awful bridge joints or rough road sections found on some interstates.The ball-and-socket joint provides for plenty of adjustment range, and the angled arm also permits a good range of adjustment for various windshield angles.

Reviews.Title: nice windshield mount
Reviews.Author: Steve Thompson
Reviews.Content: I bought this windshield mount thinking it may be mediocre, I was thinking I may have to get a disk to hold it without it loosing it's suction, and to my surprise... it held firm and with the pivot point screws... it kept my camera from moving around, I'll need to get another one

Reviews.Title: Worked well
Reviews.Author: ReyAce
Reviews.Content: Used for mounting small cameras on offroad vehicles... has worked well many times on the interior, never used on the exterior though.

Reviews.Title: DID NOT MEET  MY EXPECTATIONS
Reviews.Author: G B.
Reviews.Content: IT WAS 3 INCHES SHORT. I FOUND OUT I HAD TO BUY THE EXTENSION SEPERATLY. I DONTRECOMMEND A PRODUCT THAT HAS TO BE BOUGHT IN TWO SEPERATE PIECES.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Warm and dry in ABQ
Reviews.Content: We had tried several windshield mounts for our car camera, and they all wound up on the dash board because the suction cup didn't hold. This unit has been on the windshield since we purchased, and has held just fine, even in the 90+ temps we have here in New Mexico. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: Use for surveillance
Reviews.Author: joe velasquez
Reviews.Content: Grate devise to have !!! I recomend it for surveillance use when ur out their doing a code 5 ..

Reviews.Title: Amazing little device.
Reviews.Author: David Carter
Reviews.Content: Easily holds an entry level dslr or speed light to glass or plexiglas.  I use mine for attaching speed lights to hockey glass.

Reviews.Title: Maybe not.....
Reviews.Author: ECHO444
Reviews.Content: I purchased the mount to mount my camcorder in the window of my Jeep Grand Cherokee.... it does not fit. I read reviews and looked at pics online before buying and see people using a camcorder but I guess an SUV windshield as a steeper angle. I spent another $10 and bought the 3" extension.... for a total of $40 I'm not sure it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: Held tight all day
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "mzliberty"
Reviews.Content: I tried several camera mounts that didn't work, but this one held my camera all day at the track. This was at high speed, with plenty of vibration. The suction is really good. The only reason for 4 instead of 5 stars is that it is a little bulky.

Reviews.Title: Works great.
Reviews.Author: anthony mersino
Reviews.Content: The base is bigger than I expected but the are articulates well and holds my "Contour Roam" really well. No issues with it moving when even when I hit big pot holes.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Grip
Reviews.Author: Harrisfire
Reviews.Content: This is the second one I've ordered, first one still in use!  The suction cup grip is nothing short of amazing, the only thing it can't hold to is my pelican case - but even there it will grip for about 5-6 minutes.  It's the EXACT same thing as the Contour branded one, just $10 cheaper - the only downside I can see is it's kinda difficult to adjust the screws (for tension) once mounted.  Definitely worth purchasing.

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: Jfalcon
Reviews.Content: Huge suction cub, very sturdy adjustment, all around solid product.  I bought this to replace the cheap camera mount that came with my dash cam.  Hopefully this lasts.

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised
Reviews.Author: Melvin J Prisbrey
Reviews.Content: As pictured and it supports my camera and has all the adjustment I need for my installation.I would buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Excellent windshield mount.
Reviews.Author: Peter Matusov
Reviews.Content: I had a camera mounted using Panavise mount during a five-day off-road trip to Utah; the mount never failed despite all shock and vibration, yet it was easy to mount/move/remove etc. The camera's motion was much less pronounced than hand-held.A really great tool.The only minor drawback is the clearance between the windshield and the 1/4-20 mount; a large/long camera will need the extension to clear the windshield, and it will likely vibrate more.

Reviews.Title: Works
Reviews.Author: A Van Vleet
Reviews.Content: It works. It's pretty beefy and kind of heavy but great unit for the price, lots of ability for adjustment.

Reviews.Title: I like it plenty. It was what I was expecting .
Reviews.Author: Luis Felipe Rios Zermeno
Reviews.Content: I like it plenty.It was what I was expecting .Since I saw this productI knew that it was what I was needing

Reviews.Title: Hard worker
Reviews.Author: David Gillespie
Reviews.Content: This guy is pretty tough and I would rate it 5 stars if the arm were just a bit longer.  Like so many others who have reviewed this mount I really could use a bit more - nah I am not gonna say it.

Reviews.Title: Great mount for aviation filming!
Reviews.Author: BVIV
Reviews.Content: Have this in my sailplane and I love how adjustable it is and how stable a platform. Great product and good value!

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: stephen m fitts
Reviews.Content: I used this product to hold my camera on my windshield when I was in Iraq.  It never slipped once.  Took great, still video and never really bounced.  Would buy another one of these.

Reviews.Title: Great mount
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Sticks to just about anything smooth. I use it to mount to front of Polaris Ranger. Stays put no matter how rough the trail.

Reviews.Title: It sucks - literally AND figuratively!
Reviews.Author: R. Smolak
Reviews.Content: Bought this for an upcoming road trip and tested it today.  While the suction mount is incredibly strong, the combination of this with the 812-03 extension, my car (Mazda Miata) and camera (Canon PowerShot SX230HS) produced abysmal results during at <30 m.p.h. test in my subdivision.  Camera shake was horrendous even with the lens zoomed to full wide-angle and the image stabilization set to continuous.  Granted, the Miata doesn't have a sofa-glide ride but the video I took looked like the camera was hand-held by someone who had overdosed on caffeine.  Works fine for stationary applications but that's not what I bought it for.  Unit returned.

Reviews.Title: Tested with Nikon D90
Reviews.Author: Berny
Reviews.Content: I dont recommend this suction-cup mount for a pro camera because of the weight.Now I have a Gopro Hero3 and with the tripod adapter works well.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: H
Reviews.Content: This is exactly what I was looking for! I wanted to use my digital camera to record my driving in case I ever get into any accidents and would need evidence. This fits perfectly and is a solid product. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: Awesome, same thing as the Sony one for the Action Cam but cheaper
Reviews.Author: Niedballer
Reviews.Content: 10$ cheaper than the Sony equivalent re-brand and works solid.Has withheld 100+ MPH wind with no problems.Would recommend!

Reviews.Title: Car Window Sticker
Reviews.Author: P. Klinger "PKlinger"
Reviews.Content: I've used it with the Go-Pro, just what I needed, well built, at a reasonable price. Big suction cup, does it right.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal
Reviews.Author: len610
Reviews.Content: This is a very well built unit and very easy to use for not much $$$.  Highly recommend if this is what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: This sucks big time, just like it should
Reviews.Author: LImb Reaper "Brant"
Reviews.Content: I love this little suction-cup mount.  Panavise is the company that made the original suction-cup mount for GoPro.  If you loved your GoPro mount, you'll love this.  If you're considering this for a Handycam type camera you may want to consider the extension.  This mount works great on flat window glass and windshields, as in big trucks and equipment, but doesn't allow upright mounting of camera's on steeply slanted windshields in cars and pick-up trucks.  This is where the extension may come in.  Of course you can always mount the camera up-side down and correct in post.

Reviews.Title: really neat
Reviews.Author: ephiebear
Reviews.Content: This really works. It's allowed me to shoot our movies while driving. It sticks well and doesn't move on it's own.

Reviews.Title: Awsome product
Reviews.Author: FEARstyle "Scott"
Reviews.Content: I have to say that this little thing has a lot of suction for what it is and is way better built than the ones contour or gopro sells as is. I mounted a contour + 2 to this and even put this to a plastic sled to go sledding with my 3 year old and the footage was great. I've used it mounting internally and externally on my car as well as window mounting.

Reviews.Title: Great Item
Reviews.Author: Tom Paulus
Reviews.Content: Stably and securely holds a small camcorder to the outside windshield of a car going 60mph for more than 30 minutes. Very good purchase, panavise quality!

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Mark Garety
Reviews.Content: I use this to mount a small video camera in my car. The suction is very strong and the product is very sturdy. When I watch video that I have taken using this mount, I don't get any camera shake or vibration. Customer service from Panavise has been very good as well. I am 100% satisfied with this mount.Pros:-Strong Suction-Easy to setup-Sturdy & doesn't shake when used in a vehicle.-Quality construction & materialsCons:-None

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: Mark Fernandes
Reviews.Content: It's a great mount, built very well and sticks to any non porous surface like glue, great buy! Would buy again.

Reviews.Title: Sturdy
Reviews.Author: HRW4
Reviews.Content: I was quite impressed at just how well this suction cup mount worked. It held perfectly onto glass and plexiglass surfaces, had little to no vibration when used in the car and it's made of quality materials. There is some plastic but there are also many metal parts. It's heavy, but not too heavy.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Mike O
Reviews.Content: I ordered 2 of these for taking videos when I race (New England Hillclimb Association). I use one on my windshield and the other I will put outside the car with a tether. I have found that if you attach it correctly and mount it to stable surfaces the video quality is usually good. I would buy these again.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Suction Cup Mount
Reviews.Author: dfkendrick
Reviews.Content: WoW!  This mount is rock solid.  I use it when I shoot video in the airplane and it stays where I put it.  It is very well made and all thumb screws tighten very well.  Buy it!

Reviews.Title: Difficult to attach suction cup properly and lever is flimsy
Reviews.Author: Luan C. Do
Reviews.Content: This was attractively priced.  Unfortunately, I think the design is not the best compared to other brands.  To properly attach the suction cup securely, you have to push the round portion in the middle firmly (hard) and then flip a lever attached to the suction cup.  The lever feels very flimsy, however, and it flexes considerably as it is being flipped to the hold position.  In my previous review, I had not figured out how to work this so it didn't hold very well.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera Mount
Reviews.Author: SunnyMercedes
Reviews.Content: This was the camera mount my hubby wanted after he reasearched online(Extensively). He uses this product when we go on road trips - he mounts our camera on it and programs the camera to take photos every 15 minutes. The mount is very stable and we never had a problem with the camera falling off. The mount can always be rotated for better angles and such.

Reviews.Title: Great mount
Reviews.Author: C. Wilson
Reviews.Content: I use this in the windshield of my Viper to capture the auto club that I drive with and some of the drives to shows.  can manipulate to pretty much every angle possible.

Reviews.Title: Get's a grip!
Reviews.Author: Fish1960
Reviews.Content: I purchased this suction mount to position a portable 7" LCD monitor at the helm of my boat. Drilling holes into the helm to permanently mount the monitor was not a strategy that interested me. This product was perfect for my application. The LCD monitor is being used as a repeater display for my portable PC based marine chartplotter/navigation system.  This suction mount is very stable, durable, and flexible as far as variable positioning is concerned.  With a flip of the suctioning lever I can quickly detach the monitor from the helm and put my portable navigation system away for safe storage or use the components for another purpose. I also use this mount to attach the same 7" monitor to my truck windshield to display my PC based GPS road navigation system.  Excellent product that I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Meyer
Reviews.Content: I have a Canon S1 IS that I mount in my dashboard.  My old system -- tripod mounted on dashboard with Velcro -- finally drove me crazy, so I purchased the Panavise 809 with the extension.  I have the suction cup on the lower part of the windshield with the arm coming across the dashboard, with the extension going up.  The camera then faces out the front of the car, right-side up.  It works great.  The only vibration I see is what I would see while driving the car and is not really noticeable on my PC monitor unless I'm looking for it.  The suction cup has been on the windshield without falling off for at least three or four months.  It was a little difficult to set up, but I think that's just because of the awkwardness of trying to get into the place where I wanted to mount it.  I'm very happy with it.  Well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: Patrick
Reviews.Content: Very nice solid piece for the price. It's absolutly no vibration or shaking of the camera as you drive around. Dips, bumps or other road conditions doesn't matter, it's very steady. Need to have the camera upside down due to the angle of the window, but you can rotate the video in your movie maker program so that is a minor "flaw". Look no further, this is the mount to get, you will like it!

Reviews.Title: Very good camera mount
Reviews.Author: TJ
Reviews.Content: I got this mount to use as a dash cam holder for my camera. I used a Canon G12 which is a bit bulky so I had to mount it upside down and just flip the film which is no big deal. But this mount came in handy when I was involved in a rear end accident. Not only did the mount stay put, but it also recorded the impact during the accident. So if you're worried about the fall down, or something else happening - dont! If this camera mount didn't fall off when a car hit me doing 60MPH+, then it will do fine.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my Contour
Reviews.Author: Carnac767
Reviews.Content: I bought this item from Amazon to mount my Contour Roam Helmet Cam to the inside of my front windshield.  It works perfectly for that purpose and gives me the option of many different viewing angles.  So far I've used it on three different vehicles:  Hyundai Santa Fe, Honda Pilot, and BMW 325 convertible.  The Panavise has worked well on all three.

Reviews.Title: Works very well
Reviews.Author: D. Hawkins
Reviews.Content: This thing really surprised me.  It sticks really well to my motorcycle.  I tied it on just to be sure I didn't lose an expensive camera, but it stuck and stayed stuck.  When its time to remove it, it comes off fairly easy but requires a little effort to pry the suction cup up.  It did not hurt the surface it was stuck to either.  When its clamped down, it holds the camera ridged.  There are several joints that allow it to be positioned where it needs to be.

Reviews.Title: Sticks like crazy! Slight vibration on windshield though.
Reviews.Author: Jeff  in Tucson
Reviews.Content: I bought this to take time-lapse photos with a Logitech web cam during long road trips. The suction cup sticks to the windshield amazingly well. It's even kind of hard to get it off. LOL.I'm giving it four stars due to the slight vibration I see when going over typical city bumps ([...] I've seen other videos where the camera's image stabilization seems to take care of most of it. Some of this might be due to my camera (Canon SX210 IS).I'm happy with the purchase since I think it will work well for static photos, and it works much better than duct taping my web cam to the mirror. :) The price can't be beat either.

Reviews.Title: Awesome little camera mount
Reviews.Author: bj
Reviews.Content: We use this camera mount to record trips in our Model A Ford for our club.  It does an awesome job and there is very little vibration.

Reviews.Title: Glad I found it on Amazon
Reviews.Author: fiddlesticks
Reviews.Content: We love to have a camcorder mounted in our truck to use on trips or when needed, I have made some homemade ones myself out of sponges, duct tape & so on but none of them were as strong & simple to mount as the  Panavise 809 Camera Window Suction-Cup Mount, I mounted ours on the back window of my single cab pickup..... I added a image of it if you would like to view it...... & it works out just fine. All I have to do now is to figure out a way to have the wife keep the windshield clean.

Reviews.Title: Extremely badass unit
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: Extremely powerful suction mountExtremely rigid designVery sturdyVery versatileExtremely powerful suction mountExtremely rigid designVery sturdyVery versatile

Reviews.Title: very sturdy
Reviews.Author: Stephen M. Ingersoll
Reviews.Content: So I purchased this unit with the intention of using it as a "dashcam" mount.  I work in law enforcement and not every vehicle I use is outfitted with a departmentally issued dashcam.  With this installed I can run a small HD camcorder on the dash of my vehicle to record suspect searches and vehicle stops for use in court.  This mount is very sturdy and exceptionally well made.  It was much heavier than I had thought it would be, which is a good thing in my book.  All in all I'm very impressed and happy with this mount.

Reviews.Title: These things are great!
Reviews.Author: Ken Pauley
Reviews.Content: This is actually the second one of these I have purchased and I can't be happier. The suction cup always has a nice solid hold on whatever surface you attach it to and the head is pretty configurable, especially with the extended arm. I could deduct a star for not including the extended arm but it's always just a phone call away.So far with these mounts I have managed to take several outside-of-the-car videos with the mount stuck to the roof and door of my car. The mount has never not stick to whatever surface I have applied it to and even with hard yanking it does not come off. It also has never left a mark on any glass or painted surface I have mounted it to.Edit: I just called Panavise and apparently they are no longer just sending the extension arm. Apparently that was a promo that ended in March of 2011. The arms are $9 from Panavise. If you call in and order they can offer to send it via USPS which will save you about $5 on shipping.

Reviews.Title: Stays stuck to my windshield in 100+ degree Texas heat.
Reviews.Author: JD
Reviews.Content: This mount is incredibly versatile. It's easy to reposition and it's easy to take on and off. The camera I mount on it isn't light (approx three pounds) and this mount has never come undone from my windshield. It gets jarred around a lot offroad and it sits in the sun all day. All in all I've been very pleased with this little mount. Will definitely buy again if I need to.

Reviews.Title: Just what I needed
Reviews.Author: maxim240sx
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for use while on surveillance for my company. It works just as advertised. I built a custom setup for my particular application and have been using it since. I think the price is great compared with the local spy store prices.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for small and light cameras
Reviews.Author: S. M. Pitman
Reviews.Content: I bought this to record video from my race car during sanctioned events. When coupled with a SMALL camera you cannot possibly ask for more. This thing holds on harder than clamping-style mounts.It's lasted 2 seasons so far and it's never fallen off of the car. I used to only use it inside, but after my confidence in it grew, I started mounting it on the exterior. This is a fantastic product. Don't buy the knock-offs; my friend has one, and it's not safe for vehicle use.I would imagine that putting a heavy camera on it would compromise it's stability, though.

Reviews.Title: Panavise Camera Mount
Reviews.Author: Julian Angus
Reviews.Content: I purchased this suction-cup camera mount to be used with a Sony HDR150 video camera. I use it attached to the windshield of my car to create POV video movies for training purposes.  It is strong and once is attached to the windshield it can hold even heavier SLR cameras such as a Nikon D200.  The manipulator arm can be adjusted to just about any position.  I highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Great mount!
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: This mount works great with my Flip camera. It gives me the opportunity to film my Jeep driving over different obsticles off road without taking my hands off the wheel. It is a good, stable mount.

Reviews.Title: Heavy Duty
Reviews.Author: John K. Mauney Jr
Reviews.Content: I haven't used this item yet, but found it to be far more well constructed and heavy duty that would be expected for the price.

Reviews.Title: Panavise Camera Mount
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Hodge "dane lover"
Reviews.Content: For your money, the Panavise Suction-Cup Window Mount is the best you can buy. The mount has a tremendous hold on the windshield. It rotates to most any position desired. And there is very little vibration and movement of the camera once it is attached to the mount. Quality merchandise and a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Arm to short for windshield
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Scruffy"
Reviews.Content: The device is nice but the swivel arm is to short to put and video camera on it and still aim through the windshield. If you plan to use it elsewhere, it will work fine. I was very disappointed but after a little creativity and a trip to Home Depot, I got it to work by mounting a tile on the dash and the mount on the tile.

Reviews.Title: Still needs another extension
Reviews.Author: MJ Trierweiler
Reviews.Content: I bought to use for a Sony handy cam to be mounted on the windshield to tape me car racing.  It didn't fit the camera without an extension piece.  I sure don't remember it saying that in the description.  Other than that the quality is sturdy and the suction cup is strong.  It feels well built.

Reviews.Title: Not perfect, but good enough
Reviews.Author: Roger Maxwell
Reviews.Content: Despite tightening the thumb wheel after attaching my small camera to the mounting screw, the camera will still swivel around the screw. The suction cup works well and overall quality is very good, but I am concerned with the longevity of the rivet on the suction cup puller lever.

Reviews.Title: Good product, but.....
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: This is a very well engineered product but I thought it would work with any camcorder or camera that has a tripod mount hole. Wrong. It will only work with cameras that have the threaded hole on the top of the camera.  Most cameras/camcorders I have seen have the hole on the bottom. In desparation, I mounted my camera upside down, and found software to rotate the captured videos to right side up. I noticed later that the feature description states that the mount is for CCTV cameras. All that said, I used the mount for my camera mounted in my car's windshield when I did laps at a racetrack and it worked perfectly. Except that I had to purchase QuickTime Pro software in order to view the video right side up.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Motorcycle Mount for camera or GPS!
Reviews.Author: eternalodyssey
Reviews.Content: I bought this item to mount a very small lightweight camera (ATC3K)to my motorcycle and what initially attracted me to this item was the fact that it was advertised to handle 3 lb cameras. At only $20 this was a great bargain. With this in mind, I figured it would stand up to some abuse while using it mounted to my gas tank and to the fairings of my Suzuki GSXR. After recieving the unit through the post I opened up the package to find a rather heavy duty item. This thing just looked like it was designed to be put through the wringer. I immediately attached it to a mildly smooth table (not glass). I was amazed how strong the sution cup was when affixed and clamped down! I then mounted it to my tank and took it for a ride and sure as anything, that thing just stuck like it was welded to my tank. Playing back the footage I can see that it actually did a decent job of providing a little bit of cushion to the imperfections of the road while using the camera on some not-too-smooth roads. I was expecting much more shaky footage than I got from my camera. The ultimate test was my track bike. I have fibreglass bodywork on my track bike that I rattle canned myself when I bought the bike. I was never much concerned with looks so much as I just wanted the bike useable. When I rattle-canned the bodywork, the paint ran a little bit and I have imperfections where I mounted the suction cup. Nevertheless, that sucker stuck to my imperfect bodywork like it was welded on! I tried just the mount first. Then I mounted the camera on the side of the bike. AMAZING! I have heard some people are using this primarily for smooth surfaces like glass but I personally report that it will work on imperfect relatively smooth surfaces such as motorcycle fairings, unprofessionally painted surfaces, and the like.Pros: Cheap price, VERY sturdy materials, strong suction cup attached very well, fast shipping, standard universal camera bolt, compact size.Cons: None I could find.Bottom Line: BUY IT!!! You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: William Kusy
Reviews.Content: Very easy to set up.  Make taking self photo a snap.  fits on windows or any part of a surface that is flat.  Good use while traveling in car and using fender or glass as tripod.

Reviews.Title: Good quality but has limitations...
Reviews.Author: Shadow Man
Reviews.Content: Purchased 2 of these to mount security cameras. Suction cup holds really well and mount itself is of above-average quality. Only objection is that which other purchasers noted was the shortness of the "extension arm" - it's too short for most use. Others commented that they contacted Panavise and recieved a free extension arm but that freebee is no more. Plan on laying out another $18-$20 bucks to include shipping, which is what Panavise is charging for the 3" extension arm (which you'll probably need). That said, I have to deduct 2 stars for value. By the time you're done, you're probably paying 2x that which Amazon sells the unit itself for. If you can get by without the extension arm, you'll be fine and very happy with this mount.

Reviews.Title: Fairly Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Andrew Peterson
Reviews.Content: A very nice product.  It is constructed of high quality materials.  The locking mechanisms function properly and secure it from most vibrations.  There is one thing to consider when purchasing this.  If your camera anchors on the bottom, consider whether you will have sufficient clearance to look past the suction cup without hitting the camera into the windshield of your vehicle.  Something which may have improved the versatility of this product is a longer arm that would permit it to live a bottom-mounted camera above the suction cup with adequate clearance.

Reviews.Title: Solid piece of equipment, but needs a longer mount.
Reviews.Author: ALEJANDRO
Reviews.Content: This is a great product for a great price. It is quality built!The only thing I would improve or better disclose, is that the arm is not long enough to mount a forward facing camera on the windshield. I would have been willing to purchase the extended arm but it was not offered.

Reviews.Title: Great mount for road trips.
Reviews.Author: Benner
Reviews.Content: Went on a 3600 mile road trip and used this to mount my SD780 shooting a time lapse the entire time. The footage turned out great. The mount is rock solid and had no issue mounting it to my windshield. My only wish for it would be to have a quick release mount for the camera. The current method works fine, but i wouldn't want to have to mount and release it often.

Reviews.Title: the arm is too short for car's front window screen!!
Reviews.Author: Sakhr Al-Hendawi
Reviews.Content: I'm a petrol-head, and I like to record my driving, so I have purchesed this to record my-self driving, and once I recieved it I discovered that it does not work on new model cars, because all new cars have a very slope front window screen, so when you wanna put it on the front window you will not have any room for the camera unless you have the extension arm or put the camera up-side-down (which means you need an editing software to rotate the video), other than that it works fine.but if the main reason you will buy this product to fix on a car's front window screen get the extension arm or get one with a longer arm, you can actually see in the product pictures that all the pictures of front window mount have the extension arm.

Reviews.Title: Tough Mount
Reviews.Author: txmikey "Tx Mikey"
Reviews.Content: Used this mount to capture video of my trip across country.The dirty windshield didn't help the images but the mount worked like a champ.

Reviews.Title: Very well made, but incomplete for using a point & shoot camera
Reviews.Author: M. Soto
Reviews.Content: I purchased this because of the very high rating that people were giving it. In terms of built quality, this is one solid product. It's got very durable construction, and the suction cup and mount are *strong*. I don't foresee any consumer grade camera falling down with this. The reason I gave it four, rather than five stars is because is that this product isn't adequate for holding a consumer point & shoot out of the box inside of a car windshield. I had presumed that inside of a vehicle, next to a windshield, the 809 alone should be just fine. The windshield of my 2007 Toyota Matrix isn't that steep, I thought. However, I found that it wouldn't work. If your windshield has any sizable rake (or tilt to it, like in a coupes and sedans), there's no way to mount a consumer point & shoot digital camera right-side up, adequately. There just simply isn't enough room. Ya, some pics show people buying the extension arm from Panavise. And, unless I missed it, the Panavise extension arm is nowhere to be found on Amazon, so you've got to buy direct from Panavise ([...]). So, I went to look at Panavise's site to purchase it. With tax and shipping, I'd be spending close to $20!! And $20 for an extension arm for a product that costs $21.81 on Amazon? I don't know - that sounds a little high to me..The way I got around this was mounting my camera hanging upside down in my car. Sure, all the menus were upside down, but it's relatively easy to use Windows Movie Maker to rotate the picture 180 degrees.For the curious, I am using this with a Nikon L18 camera.

Reviews.Title: Better Than Expected.
Reviews.Author: Rusty Spoons
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I needed to get smooth and secure shots through my windshield.The suction cup is incredible, I feel like I could tow a car using it... so something like a small camcorder is nothing to worry about.The lower-half of the neck, and the suction cup housing are constructed of sturdy plastic, the upper-half of the arm is metal.If I was able to rate the build-quality of this thing, it would be 5-stars.Not much else to say really...~Rusty

Reviews.Title: Handle JET forces(video)
Reviews.Author: Serge C. Bakmeijer
Reviews.Content: http : // www . youtube . com/watch?v=3pLbDcRWqOcAs you can see, this speaks for itself !Excellent suction cup.Product feels Very Sturdy.I'd hang my HD cam anytime on this thing !My only criticism is for my particular use, i dont have too many flat surfaces i can put it on other then the windows and door in the cockpit... which isn't the problem.For my use,.. when its on the door as seen on the video above, the Panavise 809's arms are so short that  I cant really see on my Sony Bloggie Touch's Screen how its aligned. But thats certainly not a problem of the product, but of my use.I'm thinking of getting an extension arm to accomodate my particular use.As soon as i'm using it on the cockpits side windows, im not having this problem!

Reviews.Title: It works BUT -------
Reviews.Author: singtiu
Reviews.Content: When I was searching for this product, the pictures showing up in Amazon searches were showing the items with the extender, but it never mention that this is being shipped without the extension from my purchase order. The only time it shows that it came with no extender was in the package sales statement. So you tell me, was I mislead into thinking that they come with extender or not.

Reviews.Title: Sturdy, works great!
Reviews.Author: TK
Reviews.Content: Purchased this as replacement for the "weak" windshield mount included with our dash camera...this one is sturdy!Glad we found it here on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Product / Comes With Short Arm Only
Reviews.Author: Ryan Hanan
Reviews.Content: Great product. Quality construction. Does not come with 2 extension arms like some reviews state. Comes with short arm only. Call Panavise to get a free 3 inch extension. Highly recommend. Using with a Sony HD Camcorder....

Reviews.Title: Not For Motorcycle Tank
Reviews.Author: jp2code "Joe Pool to Code .NET"

} cv_moUJEL53VB3R2WloadSwf_Core(swfLocation, swfWidth, swfHeight, flashVersion, bgColor, swfParams, flashParams, embedAttributes); return false; } function cv_moUJEL53VB3R2WloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { return _cv_moUJEL53VB3R2WloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion); } // ]]> var cv_moUJEL53VB3R2WRollOverImg = new Image(); cv_moUJEL53VB3R2WRollOverImg.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/91XfS7AircS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; var cv_moUJEL53VB3R2Wpreplay = document.getElementById('cv_moUJEL53VB3R2WpreplayImageId'); if (cv_moUJEL53VB3R2Wpreplay) { cv_moUJEL53VB3R2Wpreplay.onmouseover = function() { cv_moUJEL53VB3R2Wpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/91XfS7AircS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } cv_moUJEL53VB3R2Wpreplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_moUJEL53VB3R2Wpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/91XfS7AircS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png";
