logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_moUJEL53VB3R2WcurrentClick) { return cv_moUJEL53VB3R2WcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 1:04 MinsNice, simple device, but it does NOT work well mounted to the gas tank of a motorcycle.The suction cup on this unit is not rigidly mounted to the base. I suspect this is because the manufacturers envision this unit to be mounted to a concave surface like the inside of a windshield.The gas tank on a motorcycle is convex, and this leaves a large gap between the suction cup and the main base.In the attached video, the unit held my old Flip Ultra Video Camer during the ride, but as soon as I turned the engine off in the drive way, the suction cup lost its grip and the whole unit fell away. Luckily, I had tethered the entire assembly to my forearm using a lanyard so I did not lose anything.

Reviews.Title: Buy the  Delkin Devices DDMOUNT-SUCTION Fat Gecko Double Knuckle Dual Suction Cup Camera Mount instead.
Reviews.Author: Michael Poczynek
Reviews.Content: This mount is not of great use for anything more than a small surveillance camera.  Buy the Delkin Devices DDMOUNT-SUCTION Fat Gecko Double Knuckle Dual Suction Cup Camera Mount instead if you are looking to mount a video camera.

Reviews.Title: Solid
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: Just want to say that this is a really solid item.Heven't had much of a chance to use it but it is really sturdy and nice.  It doesn't jiggle anywhere, though the plastic base flexes a bit.Its just really well built imo.  Its great to see a company do that for a great price.BE SURE YOU GET OFFICIAL PANAVISE THOUGH.  There is a patent breaking item out there which supposedly isn't as good.  Smaller sellers might not be giving you the official panavise.  Getting the real thing is worth is (probably) for anyhting other then a non moving application (fixed placement).  Panavise won't budge

Reviews.Title: Panavise Suction-Cup Mount
Reviews.Author: Michael Novack
Reviews.Content: It does stick very well to any flat surface, but mounting a point-and-shoot camera on inside of a front window of your car is problematic due to the steep slope of most windows and the shortness of the mounting arm.  You end up with your camera mounted upside down ... and unless your video editing software allows you to flip the image it's pretty well pointless.There are extension arms available but the issue then becomes vibration with the extended arm.

Reviews.Title: Just so you know
Reviews.Author: David F Peterson
Reviews.Content: Just so you know.  I you have the genuine Panavise 809 and need the extension, just call Panavise and they will send the extension for free.I haven't had mine long so waiting on the extension to call, via USPS, but works well except that that I had to have my camcorder up-side-down due to NOT having the extension.On rough roads your picture may be jerky but remember, the Panavise 809 does not have shock absorbing so it feels what you the drive feels (can't remember seeing a mount that did have absorbing features at this price anyway.)

Reviews.Title: Great mount
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: I use this for recording autocross runs. It sticks and stays. Very stable even with a very tall video camera.

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: J3cht
Reviews.Content: I've been using it excessively for a little over a week now, and its working quite well for me.

Reviews.Title: Strong, sturdy mount
Reviews.Author: Darrell
Reviews.Content: Great mount. Very solid. I called Panavise on Thursday to let them know I needed the extension. It arrived on Saturday. No charge. Can't beat that for customer service. It even came with the hex key you need to install it. A high quality product in every way. Be sure to buy your 809 from Amazon so you don't get a knock off.

Reviews.Title: What a GREAT company
Reviews.Author: Ed C
Reviews.Content: I ordered one of these mounts so I could record video during our trips. The problem I have with this product is that the arm is a little too small and I could not get the correct angle for my JVC digital recorder. I had read in other post that there was a extension arm for this product so I emailed Julie at PanaVise and within minutes I had a response from her. The next email I received from Julie was a confimation that the extension was on it's way at no cost to me.I have not seen customer service like this is a LONG time. This company is going into my favorites list.

Reviews.Title: Best mount and price !!
Reviews.Author: Home Owner "Amazon Man"
Reviews.Content: The mount works good and holds well but for most windshield apps you will need the 3 inch arm extension for camera to clear the windshield. I simply called the manuf. and they sent the arm for FREE. With the arm though you will get some bounce in the camera but not bad. Great for track days. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Beware
Reviews.Author: Movie Watcher
Reviews.Content: This is a quality product. However, the pictures on the product description page are misleading. The Panavise 809 I received only had the single knuckle. The pictures show a Panavise with an extension knuckle. This knuckle allows the user more options for mounting different cameras. For a good example of what I'm referring to, look at the picture of the Delkin Devices DDMOUNT-MINI Fat Gecko Double Knuckle Single Suction Cup Camera Mount. It displays the extended knuckle.

Reviews.Title: suction cup mount for tiny cameras
Reviews.Author: G. Matot "GMS"
Reviews.Content: This is a suction cup mount for very small point and shoot cameras. It arrived in a box with a sheet of instructions. You press it against clean glass, push the air out with the PRESS button, and pull the locking lever. Then attach a camera, and that's it. I use it for a small fuji point and shoot all weather camera in my Toyota Yaris. Works as described.Pros: low cost, ease of use, versatile.Cons: short mount arm - almost impossible to use on windshields, poorly written - contradictory instructions, flexible = added camera bounce.Summary, this device is intended to be used on nearly vertical or horizontal glass, not a sloping windshield. The only way it can be used on a windshield is if the camera was upside down. It is designed to be used only with tiny lightweight digital cameras.On my car, on the windshield, when the arm is extended up for a normally positioned camera mount, there is not enough clearance between the top of the camera mounting screw and the windshield for any device. Maybe your vehicle windshield has less of an angle than my Yaris and it may work for you. And use on a door window doesn't work because there is not enough clearance to see around the roof support column to look out the windshield. It might work from a sunroof or a bathroom mirror, but only for a tiny point and shoot camera. I should try mounting it to the car hood. I did try once mounting it on the outside of the car on the windshield but feared I would earn a ticket for doing so.additional comment: After trying a few other suction cup mounts, I revert back to this one because of it's short size it adds minimal camera vibration. However, the camera you use on this must be very small because it is difficult for the camera mounting surface to give enough clearance from the mount itself to put much of anything on it. This is a great mount for the Ego digital camera. I have never had the suction cup come off even once yet.

Reviews.Title: Great lightweight camera mount.
Reviews.Author: Brandon S McDaniel
Reviews.Content: I use this mount for either a digital camera or a pocket camcorder to video my AutoX runs.  Works great, never had it fall off.  You just have to be picky where you place it, needs to be glossy and clean to make sure it holds tight when your doing 70-80mph's.  I am going to make a tether system tho so if it does come undone it wont get run over or get lost on the track somewhere.  It does shake some when its attached to bumpers and such, but thats to be expected.  Great product, lots of my friends use them as well.

Reviews.Title: Panavise 809 Camera Window Suction Cup Mount
Reviews.Author: Jasmundo
Reviews.Content: The cat's meow! The Panavise is pretty much a global standard for mounting lightweight cameras, including lightweight, memory card video cameras, to pretty much any flat, clean surface.Our city wasted who knows how much money on grinding down about 2 inches of concrete off of our 27 year-old street, which was in very good condition, then applied asphalt over the concrete that remained as the base. I needed to take a quick video of the length of our street to archive the very good condition of the already existing 27 year-old concrete. No problem. Got my Aiptek A-HD 720P camcorder, threaded it onto the Panavise 809 (1/4-20 thread), quickly cleaned a small spot on the hood of my CR-V, stuck the Panavise to that spot and threw the lockdown latch, then jumped in the car and went for a ride. When I got back home, I popped the Panavise off of the hood and reviewed the video. Perfect!Some folks use this or other versions of the Panavise 809 on the inside of their windshield to mount certain radar detectors or GPS devices which are equipped with threads. There are several models to choose from.Note: I had no hesitation mounting a $150 memory card camcorder onto this device. However, if you were mounting, say, a Canon 5D Mk II, for mobile video work, the Delkin Devices DDMOUNT-SUCTION Fat Gecko Double Knuckle Dual Suction Cup Camera Mount would probably be a better choice for your added piece of mind with a $2000 camera body, not to mention the cost of whatever lens you'd be using.

Reviews.Title: Panavise 809 review
Reviews.Author: 4N2NR
Reviews.Content: A very sturdy and versatile CCTV camera window mount. The only gripe I have is that the arm is too short for the type camera I have and the slant of my windshield. I cannot get the entire package to line up at the angle I want. It's not really the products fault nor the camera nor the car. But all 3 combined just don't work well together. The suction is great. I did a few mile test with the camera roof mounted and looking forward. The mount was stable and secure even at speeds around 60 mph.

Reviews.Title: Very good for the price!
Reviews.Author: Lisa A BROWN
Reviews.Content: Purchased this mount for my Canon HF200 HD Camcorder in my car and aircraft. Construction appears very rugged and the suction cup is plenty strong for use on glass and plexi-glass (hopefully that will persist over time too as the plastic ages). There is the slightest of wiggle/wobble when secured; But I think that's inevitable with so much camera mass at end of the mount fulcrum (which, when zoomed-out, doesn't manifest itself in my recordings [which may be result of the image stabilization on the camera]). I would recommend for the casual consumer user looking to create personal videos; but would hesitate recommending for commercial/professional video production (if you required a complete, 100% vibration/wiggle/wobble-free mount). In short: it's a good mount for the price!

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with the Panavise 809
Reviews.Author: Maestroso
Reviews.Content: The Panavise 809 does exactly what it is supposed to do:  It sticks securely to a smooth surface through its large suction cup;  It holds you camera steady with little vibration in a moving vehicle and certainly better than handheld;  It releases easily and stores with little footprint.  One caveat though:  My unit did not come with the extension arm pictured in some user reviews.  I did call Panavise as some suggested and the courteous Panavise rep told me that the unit does not come with the extension arm but that she would ship one to me immediately.  All I had to do is give her the Pat Nº.  Not quite sure how long Panavise will honor such requests, but in reality without the extension arm the use of the Panavise 809 on a windshield interior with a acute rake will not be effective, unless you camera is very low profile or you mount the camera upside down.Construction appears substantial.  For the money it is worth it and I would trust the Panavise 809 to hold my camera on the exterior of the vehicle.  In fact, I will.  Adjustments are easy.  Would certainly buy again, but only with the extension arm or as long as that is being made available post Amazon sale.  Perhaps Panavise should include it by default or Amazon should advise of the package contents so that buyers are not confused by the user pictures.Glad to give it a 4 star.  Would have most certainly given it a 5 star were it not for the missing extension arm.Maestroso

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: open file
Reviews.Content: Nice little affordable mount.  Does what it is advertised to do.  Well done!(Lots of informative reviews on here-- including video reviews-- helped me a lot!)

Reviews.Title: Exceeded my expectations
Reviews.Author: M. Johnson
Reviews.Content: This mount was far better than I could have hoped for. Considering the purchase price of around $30 I was expecting a flimsy, plastic feeling product that was only truely useful during ideal conditions (ie; low speeds and perfect roads). Panavise blew those expectations out of the water. The 809's construction feels very sturdy, and the locking points haven't losened a bit during any one of my uses. The suction cup is very powerful, once fastened it stays, no problem. I've used this on the inside and outside of my 350z, on the fairing of my sport bike, and even tried it on my quad. The image stability impressed me the most, besides the quad (just too bumpy for my camera), my videos came out great, even above highway speeds on the outside of the vehicle. I would highly recomend this to anyone looking to catch some motorsport fun. By the way, I have been useing an awfully small and light camera (a Canon sd1400 is) but I'd trust a larger camera too. Also, if you get your product and the extender isn't there just give Panavise a call and they will send it to you for free. Awesome huh? Yeah, I thought so too. Hope this is helpful.

Reviews.Title: Really Well Constructed
Reviews.Author: P. McLain
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with the quality of design and construction -- especially given the price.  You can adjust to shoot from just about any angle and the suction cup system with the locking clamp is very secure.  I am not concerned about it breaking free with an expensive video camera attached.  As noted in other reviews, if you are using a larger camera you may need the optional extension arm that is visible in some of the customer pictures.  Panavise will ship you one for free if you contact their customer service number shown on the instruction sheet.  Their CS was very pleasant to deal with, but you will need to have the unit with you to read off the Patent number.

Reviews.Title: Great Window Mount for Webcam
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this suction mount to attach a webcam to the windshield of my car for taking road-trip time lapse videos. With a little thought, I figured out a simple way to mount a Logitech Pro 9000 webcam to the threaded stud on the suction mount. Works like a charm.Was concerned when buying one of these that it wouldn't stay put, that it would, sooner or later, suddenly throw itself off the glass without any warning. This hasn't happened, even with leaving the unit in place in sunny (ie: warm) conditions for at least four days.It does not require any special degree of cleanliness on the window, or other surface preparation to make it stick effectively. When mounted, it almost feels strong enough that you could hang a manhole cover from the thing.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work on windshield with Kodak Playsport
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I bought this for the Kodak Playsport to take in-car video.  Because the Playsport is shaped like an iPhone, it doesn't fit while mounted on the inside of the windshield.  It would still work on the outside of the windshield or on a vertical side window.  Overall, it's well made and has great suction.  Price is good.5/13/10:  I too called Panavise and asked to get the extension piece.  They are mailing it to me at no charge.  That's good customer service.  Changed to four stars.

Reviews.Title: Needs to attach from the top
Reviews.Author: S. John Sponsler
Reviews.Content: This product serves its purpose but not for the standard camcorder user. This is designed to attach to a recording device from the top of the device and not the bottom. No matter how I twisted and turned this device it was unusable.However, the parts are interchangeable with the Sunpak ClampPod Pro Clamping Tripod.[...]The two resulted in some very use-able configuations for both dash and window mounting of a standard camcorder.

Reviews.Title: Gets the job done
Reviews.Author: Mango
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Panavise 809 after I noticed a lot of insane driving while on the road, lots of red light runners and in one case someone driving the wrong way onto an expressway exit. I researched every and any camera mount I could find on Amazon and this one seemed to be the best choice, so I went ahead and bought it.The mount suction cup attaches to the windshield well and I haven't had any problems with it falling off, which is good. To be able to record I have to flip the camera so it is upside down (I have a Flip Ultra Video camcorder), which I was well aware of when I bought it so it was no surprise, though a slight inconvenience when uploading onto the computer because the footage needs to be rotated.The mount does shake a tiny bit, although not too badly if the road is smoothish. The Panavise mount works really well and is not a bad buy.UPDATE: So it is now Oct 2013 and I am still using the same mount I originally purchased, plus another that I ordered soon after. They still work great. However, lately I have had issues with them falling (though not when in use!). I would find at least one of the mounts lying on the floor of my car. The suctions probably loosened due to changes in temperature and from everyday use because I NEVER drive without my cameras rolling. I noticed that one of the mount's button and push lever no longer works, most likely due from one of its falls. The mount still stays attached to the windshield fine though.

Reviews.Title: Camera Mount
Reviews.Author: John R. Lew
Reviews.Content: When taking video while holding it with your hand in a moving vehicle you get a lot of shake and can distort the image but when the camera mount is mounted on the windshield you don't get as much shake.  Though the camera is hanging upside down and the picture is upside down only the Picasa can make the video right side up.  It is very portable and can be use on anything that is not porous.

Reviews.Title: Excellent mount and support
Reviews.Author: rc
Reviews.Content: I actually bought this Panavise mount elsewhere -- where it was called something different (G-Force or whatever) on their web site and cost about 2x as much!  Then I found the identical mount here. I know it's the same because it says Panavise and has the patent number and is well constructed etc.  Other's are apparently not even getting the real product, but cheap imitations.  So, buy the Panavise here and buy it from Amazon.  As far as I know it's the best deal and also the genuine product.Regarding the product, it really is very functional, well-constructed and sturdy.  I'd buy another Panavise product as my experience is that they are of good quality.  I can also attest to the excellent customer support provided by Julia -- thanks!

Reviews.Title: Panavise 809 Camera Mount
Reviews.Author: Roberto Lim
Reviews.Content: Great product.  It did not come with the extension but it was quickly resolved soon after calling the manufacturing company which were very helpful and sent the extension asap.

Reviews.Title: Great product...
Reviews.Author: PNS "PNS"
Reviews.Content: Excellent product! Sticks to the window that I need it to stick to very well and securely. At the first joint (suction cup end), it is notched so it "clicks" at different angles (not continuous). For me, it is great since less chance of slipping. The more minute adjustments can be done at the ball joint at the other end of the arm.I received the genuine Panavise product.  So, I called the company to get the extension arm.  The extension arm is NOT included in the box; I need to call the company to get it.  The Customer Service Representative was very courteous asked for the Patent Number on the product.  They shipped the extension arm at no cost at all.Great company standing behind their product!!!

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: GameTrader
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't make a single change to this device. It holds strongly at seemingly any speed (have tested it outside the car and motorcycle at up to 80mph), is very easily adjustable, construction feels bulletproof, and it doesn't even block the memory card door on my compact camera when it's mounted. For less than $20 it's a steal.

Reviews.Title: solid and superb value
Reviews.Author: B. Nash
Reviews.Content: This mount is well engineered, can hold an SLR in place and is made of solid plastic and screws.  Panavise stands behind the product and offers accessories for different size cameras and applications.  It is lot of fun to film stuff, just don't get distracted while driving after buying it!  Drive safe out there.

Reviews.Title: Panavise Dash Mount
Reviews.Author: Monika Mcgillicuddy "Monika"
Reviews.Content: I really like the mount but felt that the description was a little inaccurate. It did not fit on both of my cars and I needed to contact the company to have them send me an extension.  Thankfully they were very responsive and sent the extension out right away free of charge. Even with the extension my Kodak zi8 is right against the window. It would be perfect if the arm was a little longer so that you can clear the angle of the windshield. It also does not work with my P&S; pocket camera. Otherwise I think it's solid and holds the video camera well.

Reviews.Title: Works just fine.
Reviews.Author: Joshua P. Wolfram
Reviews.Content: I used this to mount a video camera to my motorcycle helmet. If you are going to do the same I suggest you use a lanyard incase the suction cup comes loose. I am pleased with the quality of the mount and how well the suction cup stays in place while baring the weight of my camera.

Reviews.Title: Needs extension arm
Reviews.Author: Alan Fox
Reviews.Content: Works very well except it needs an extension arm. I've tried several camcorders and point and shoot cameras in my car with this mount. Both have to be inverted because the sloping windshield blocks them from being mounted upright. Vibration only became a problem only when using a heavy camcorder.

Reviews.Title: Does Exactly What It's Supposed To Do
Reviews.Author: Jeep4x4Enthusiast "jeep4x4enthusiast"
Reviews.Content: I am using this window mount with a Creative Labs Vado HD pocket camcorder, and Canon Powershot G10 compact camera. It's a very sturdy mount and works very well with the mentioned devices.The suction on the mount is very firm. I have total confidence when using this product.

Reviews.Title: Very impressive.
Reviews.Author: Adrian W.
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with the solid construction, design, and suction strength of the Panavise 809 Camera Window Suction Cup Mount.  The mount easily holds my Canon Elura 100 (13.1 oz), Canon SX20 IS (19.8 oz), and my Canon SD400 (4.59 oz).  When attached properly, the mount provides really stable video while driving and even more so if you use your devices optical/digital image stabilization if available. The mount is extremely solid and durable feeling.  The extension are can be obtained for free by calling the contact number on the Panavise website; customer service was extremely polite, and helpful.  I received the extension arm three days after calling, free of charge and shipping fees.Panavise 809 Camera Window Suction Cup Mount

Reviews.Title: Reviewing item Panavise 809 Camera Mount Suction cup style
Reviews.Author: Donovan C. Jones "Donovan J"
Reviews.Content: Great item , sticks very well and lots of adjustments.  Great for going high speeds or low speeds just cruising around.

Reviews.Title: Great for the money!
Reviews.Author: Bernard Jones
Reviews.Content: Unit holds well to my windshield. You may need an extention section depending on the size of you camera. If you do you can call customer service and they will send it out for free pretty quick. I would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy for a Filmmaker!
Reviews.Author: M. Jones
Reviews.Content: I reviewed a lot of suction cup camera mounts before choosing this one, and I'm glad I did. I'm an amature filmmaker in college and I'm using this mount to get some AMAZING shots for car chases with my Flip Ultra HD pocket cam. This mount is fantastic for the price and sticks extremely well. I've used it inside and outside my Kia Rio as well as other vehicles and the shot is steady, smooth, and very professional looking. As explained in other reviews, I did try to mount my Flip cam on the inside of the windscreen and shoot straight ahead, with no luck. Because I'm a filmmaker and don't plan on using it for straight ahead shots anyway, I found this to be a fantastic buy.

Reviews.Title: Great Customer Service!
Reviews.Author: Brice Mcintosh
Reviews.Content: I received my item very quickly and was quite impressed with how solid the item is. I was, however, dismayed to see that the extension arm which some of the photos showed was not included. A quick call to the manufacturer fixed that. No questions asked she asked for my name and address and shipped me the extension the same day free of charge. It is quite nice dealing with a company that is so happy to help their customers so promptly and politely. Will buy more soon!

Reviews.Title: Great, but didn't have extended arm
Reviews.Author: Eddy A. "Eddy"
Reviews.Content: As you probably have read in other reviews, you are hit or miss in terms of the necessary extension to use bottom mount cameras on your windshield with this thing.  I had a race event coming up so I shotgunned and ordered this mount overnight from Amazon.  Mine unfortunately did NOT come with the extension.  I ended up mounting it on my side window as opposed to windshield (or rear hatch glass).  Other than the lack of the extension, this thing is a stud.  Very little vibration and no noise are transmitted through this mount.  It functioned flawlessly for me and stuck to EVERY surface.  Mine was exposed to intense (INTENSE) heat and strong acceleration but didn't budge the whole day.  I didn't move or re-secure it once.  I got more than I expected from this mount.  I'm very happy.

Reviews.Title: WV Carol
Reviews.Author: Sassywvmom
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on the camera mount, I made the purchase.  The price is great, it is well worth it; good quality and design.  If you order and get the "older" version, call and ask for the extension arm if you need it.  Newer version will come equiped with the extenson (per Paravise).  Paravise's customer service can't be beat. Would purchase this product again, or other products from this company.

Reviews.Title: Panavise 809 Camera Window Suction Cup Mount
Reviews.Author: A. Contreras
Reviews.Content: Its a great little camera mount. I bought this to record my auto-x, track days events in my car. So far the mount is very well done it holds like a vise. The picture is nice firm, no jary, shifting movents when taking corners or hevey breaking, it stays put. The only thing I would rate poor is that lack of length the mount has. If it was just a bit longer it would be perfect, other than that its still great.

Reviews.Title: Great Mount For A Great Price
Reviews.Author: DigitalHand
Reviews.Content: I bought two of this mount and was pleasantly surprised at the quality for it's price. I'm using one for a Panasonic TZ5 and one for a Canon Vixia HG20. The mount worked for both holding them securely to two cars I tried it on. If you have a software that can rotate your movies easily (i.e. Sony Vegas Platinum) the easiest way to mount on a windshield is shooting upside down. The mount does work right side up but takes a bit longer to set-up depending on the windshield you mount it to. The angle of your windshield determines if you need the extension or not. The camera and the camcorder does vibrate when you hit some bumps (i.e. rail road tracks)but I expected that for the price. Small vibrations are mostly compensated by the built-in stabilizer of the camera and camcorder.

Reviews.Title: Quality camera mount
Reviews.Author: KBJ "keninirvine"
Reviews.Content: Despite being made of plastic, the Panavise is a quality-made camera mount that works well in my car.  The suction cup is very strong.

Reviews.Title: Mount
Reviews.Author: W. Glover
Reviews.Content: Nice well built holds up well hard plastic very strong holds my camera well. it is short but i can get around that

Reviews.Title: Camera window mount
Reviews.Author: Fred R. Long "Old Man"
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of the Panavise 809 CCTV camera window mounts. The brackets are good for what they are made for. I wanted them to mount on the windshield, but they are made for CCTV and would work great on an upright window. being as how the windshield slants back, my existing cameras would not fit so I purchased an inexpensive little flat camera that would work. For a flat upright surface, these are great, but for the windshield, unless you have a very small camera, forget it. It's good for what it is made for.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: mikes63737 "Mike"
Reviews.Content: It works.  It feels sturdy.  I'm using it to mount my camera to the roof of my car (a 1992 Jeep Cherokee) and the camera does not move when driving.  Bumps in the road don't make the camera wobble.  No problems, recommend 100%.

Reviews.Title: Exelent Quality
Reviews.Author: A. Jensen
Reviews.Content: Got this mount for a great price.Very powerfull suction cup on this thing. Even holds to the tank of my motorcycle !Holds up my Canon S5 Is with no movement at all.Totally recommend this product to anyone !

Reviews.Title: Came without extension
Reviews.Author: L. Huertas
Reviews.Content: I bought this mount for use with a camcorder on my cars windshield.It's IMPOSSIBLE! because it's not came with the extension bar, as shows in one of the descriptions picture.I'm really disappointed.

Reviews.Title: right price, solid !  yes, but.............
Reviews.Author: nim
Reviews.Content: the quality is good and the price right.  i purchased this mount to use when driving, to hold my camcorder and shoot out the front window of the car.  the description says that it can be used for CCTV, CAMERA OR CAMCORDER.  THIS ISN'T EXACTLY CORRECT, CCTV maybe but not camera or camcorder when being used to shoot out the front of the car.  the connection to mount the camera to the panavise 809 is for a camera that mounts from the top (screw hole at the top of the camera as opposed to the bottom of the camera), but not for camera and camcorders that have the screw hole at the bottom of the camera.  after putting some thought into this and not wanting to pay return shipping, i removed the arm and turned it around so that it is reversed, then added a hose washer to the part that screws into the camera body (screw is to long for my camera, the washer made for a much tighter and secure fit and keeps my camera from being damaged when tightening).after i made these minor changes the panavise 809 worked great.if you have already purchased this item, try turning the arm around and see of that works for you.if you are still debating the purchase maybe another product would do a better job, one that attaches to the bottom of the camera.

Reviews.Title: Good to a point
Reviews.Author: William W. Hopper "William West Hopper"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to use for in-car videos using my small cannon camera.The pivit is not really enough to focus the camera downward when attatched to the windshield.  And the extension of the arm is not really long enough to use a larger camera on.It may work mounted on the sunroof outside or on a side window, I have yet to try it.The suction cup does not adhere to my dash.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Boarder2
Reviews.Content: Exactly as shown.  Holds my HF100 HD camcorder upside down very easily.  Great product.

Reviews.Title: BOGUS PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: Mark Brooks
Reviews.Content: Ordered the Panavise 809 window suction cup mount, and it came to me from VanGoddy ... I didn't get the extension arm with it, so I called Panavise and they advised me to check it for a patent number, which would be on the lip near the suction cup.  I checked mine, and there was no patent number.. which indicates that it's a counterfeit product.  Which was sold to me as a Panavise product.  Now, I've got a product that is not supported by the company who it was supposed to have been made by, and nobody is answering the phone at VanGoddy.  My reason for calling Panavise in the first place was to try to get the extension arm for the 809.. then when we determined that I had a counterfeit product, they told me that even if I bought an arm, it wouldn't work on the counterfeit product.  STAY AWAY FROM VAN GODDY!!!!!

Reviews.Title: DCR-HC96 Wont fit.. nice product though..well made
Reviews.Author: Partsgal "Heidi"
Reviews.Content: well made but the smaller camcorders dont have enough height to "see/view" over the suction mount..

Reviews.Title: Beware of the windshield you are putting it on
Reviews.Author: Jeff Barker
Reviews.Content: I took this to Hawaii to video the Road to Hana and this thing was just a disappointment.  Worked fine on my Jeep Grand Cherokee at home but not on the rental car.  The slope for the windshield on the rental was not conducive to use this.  Needless to say, my video efforts were horrible with this device.  It is limited on the angles you can position it.  Big disappointment!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: No suction!
Reviews.Author: C. David
Reviews.Content: No matter what I do, I can't get this thing to take hold of any surface of my car. Cleaning every surface, moistening the suction cup - nothing creates a grip.I'm in a Corolla, so perhaps the angle of the windshield makes this impossible to use, but it's also dangerous : the mount clattered to my feet as I was driving, nearly wedging underneath the brake.Ultimately, this is too unreliable to use safely. Total waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Sturdy product
Reviews.Author: Mr. Bruce
Reviews.Content: I just got my panavise 809 from amazon. I am very happy with this sturdy product. I could have give it a stars but I give it a 4 star. Because the extension piece has a design problem and their poor quality control did not catch the mating problem. I have to cut (saw) off about .300 of an inch of the extension piece in order to mate to the panavise base. Over all I am still recommand this product. It stick like glue.

Reviews.Title: 809 Suction Mount Defective: destroyed camera
Reviews.Author: Fernando Vohk
Reviews.Content: This product deserves no stars at all, but apparently one star must be given in order to submit. In simple terms, the Panavise 809 suction mount DESTROYED a $1200 Canon Vixia camcorder that was in perfect condition until using this mount. The mounting screw was defective. It is too long. And yet it fits easily into the camera, just as theoretically it was designed to do. Unfortunately, once it fits inside, that too long screw effectively destroys the camera.Comparing it to other tripod mounts at the repair facility, it was that someone at the factory either put in the wrong screw, or created a defective product. It is not the customer's responsibility to ascertain that a product is not defective. I do a fair amount of writing for consumer magazines and blogs, I review a variety of products, and it's comparatively rare to find such an egregious oversight.Beware: the low price indicates that QA is severely lacking. We have contacted the manufacturer and we'll see what happens from there - but if you buy this product don't install it without measuring the screw and measuring that of a standard tripod mount before using it. Do not trust that it has been adequately inspected. Better to be out $20 than $1200.

Reviews.Title: Will probably not fit most cameras Flip, Panasonic, etc- needs an extension
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: Unless you drive a 1980s vehicle that has a windshield that is almost vertical this device will probably not work for you with a modern car with a slanted front windshield  and you'll have to mount the camera upside down. I managed to mount the camera at 90% and was able to rotate the lens (Contour HD) but I'm sure most people will not be able to mount a camera on a modern car's windshield without having problems.Pity cos the item appears to be well made and quite nice for the price but as someone pointed out, all the photos have the camera with an extension arm. Odd. Will probably send it back.WHERE IS THE EXTENSION ARM PANAVISE ???!!!! Sure it's only a couple more cents to make the plastic arm longer but this is a MAJOR DESIGN FLAW SO BE ADVISED!!

Reviews.Title: Where is it made?
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: This does work for what I bought it for but my problem with it is that the box clearly states "Made In The USA Sold Worldwide", but on the bottom of the suction cup it says "Made In China". I try to buy products made in the USA and I don't mind paying more for them, but when the box says made in the USA and the item has made in china on it something is wrong.

Reviews.Title: Try Pedco Clamp
Reviews.Author: GordoninVT
Reviews.Content: My friend told me to go with the Pedco Clamp for use in my car . He said to mount it to the visor with my camera upside down(yes , you'll have to reverse the images on your computer)but this should dampen out the heavy vibrations that is a common complaint with windshield mounts. I'll let you know how it works after my 1st months trial period .

Reviews.Title: My son purchased a mount that was defective: Panavise refuses to acknowledge issue
Reviews.Author: Genie Davis "Genie"
Reviews.Content: The Panavise 809 suction mount DESTROYED a $1200 Canon Vixia camcorder that was in perfect condition until using this mount. The mounting stud was defective. It is too long. And yet it fits easily into the camera, just as theoretically it was designed to do. Unfortunately, once it fits inside to the degree that the camera is stabilized, that too long stud destroys the camera.Comparing it to other tripod mounts at the repair facility, someone at the factory either put in the wrong screw, or created a defective product. It is not the customer's responsibility to ascertain that a product is not defective. However, in trying to deal with Panavise's owner, I've been stone walled, informed that some mysterious G Force must've attacked the camera (seriously), told that a  washer missing from the product that was shipped to us was no big deal, there couldn't possibly be a QA error even though the stud in ours is twice their own indicated stud length measurement etc. In other words Panavise refuses to talk to the repair facility that repairs thousands of cameras every year and can explain precisely what the problem with the mount is and how the damage would have happened. They refuse to talk to me or my son. But they insist they can't be wrong, hoping I'll go away. Hoping that $800 plus dollars in repair bills will just vanish.Do you want to support a company that does business this way?Please, if you buy this product don't install it without measuring the stud and measuring that of a standard tripod mount before using it. Do not trust that it has been adequately inspected.

ProductInfo.Features:
Allows Users To Quickly Move Cameras From Vehicle To Vehicle Or Location To Location
1/4-20 Stud With Lock Ring
Powerful Suction Pad Attaches To Any Smooth, Flat, Nonporous Surface Including Windows, Sheet Metal, Fiberglass, Etc.
Full Range Of Motion At The Camera-knob Adjustment 210 Degree Tilt, 360 Degree Turn and 360 Degree Rotation
Ratcheted Arm Has 140 Degree Vertical Motion
Suction pad is 3.4' (86.4mm) in diameter
Overall length is approximately 4.5' (114.3mm)
Recommended for cameras weighing up to 3 lbs. (1.4kg)
Combine with the PanaVise 3-inch extension (model#: 812-03) which provides extra versatility and clearance for mounting cameras on steep windshields
ProductInfo.Name: Panavise 809 Camera Window Suction-Cup Mount
